Module promethium.lang
Package io.github.epi155.pm.lang

Interface Hope<T>

Type Parameters:
T - value type
All Superinterfaces:
AnyError, AnyValue<T>, ChoiceContext<T>, Glitch, ItemStatus, SingleError
public interface Hope<T> extends SingleError, AnyValue<T>
Utility interface for carrying a single error xor a value

The interface has static constructors with value or custom error message 

      Hope.of(T value);                                // final value
      Hope.failure(CustMsg ce, Object... argv);       // error message
and with Exception 
      Hope.capture(Throwable t);      // error from Exception (package level)
      Hope.captureHere(Throwable t);  // error from Exception (method level)

The outcome of the interface can be evaluated imperatively 

      if (hope.completeWithoutErrors()) {
          val value = hope.value();
          // ... action on value
      } else {
          val fault = hope.fault();
          // ... action on error
      }
or functionally 
      hope
          .onSuccess(v -> { ... })     // ... action on value
          .onFailure(e -> { ... });    // ... action on error

      R r = hope.<R>mapTo(
          v -> ...R,      // function from value to R
          e -> ...R);     // function from error to R

    • capture

      @NotNull static <S> @NotNull Hope<S> capture(@NotNull @NotNull Throwable t)
      Create an error Hope

      The first class / method / line of the stacktrace, which has the same package as the class it calls capture (limited to the first two namespaces), is identified as a detail of the error

      Type Parameters:
      S - type value in case of success
      Parameters:
      t - exception to catch
      Returns:
      Hope instance

    • map

      @NotNull <R> @NotNull Hope<R> map(@NotNull @NotNull Function<? super T,Hope<R>> fcn)
      Compose operator

      Hope • Hope → Hope

      The method allows to compose two hopes. Using an imperative outcome evaluation we would have 

            Hope<A> ha = computeA();
      Hope<B> hb;
      if (ha.completeWithoutErrors()) {
          hb = a2b(ha.value());           // Hope<B> a2b(A value);
      } else {
          hb = Hope.<B>failure(ha);
      }
      The method simplifies it to 
            Hope<B> hb = computeA().map(this::a2b);
      Type Parameters:
      R - result type
      Parameters:
      fcn - transform value to result Hope
      Returns:
      result Hope instance, if this has an error, the transformation is not called and the result has the original error

    • mapOut

      @NotNull <R> @NotNull Some<R> mapOut(@NotNull @NotNull Function<? super T,? extends AnyValue<R>> fcn)
      External compose operator to Some

      Hope • AnyValue+ → Some

      Type Parameters:

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • mapOf

      @NotNull <R> @NotNull Hope<R> mapOf(@NotNull @NotNull Function<? super T,? extends R> fcn)
      map value

      Hope • value → Hope

      Type Parameters:
      R - result type
      Parameters:
      fcn - mapping function
      Returns:
      Hope instance with new value, if this has errors, the transformation is not called and the result has the original error; RuntimeException are caught as new error

    • peek

      @NotNull @NotNull Hope<T> peek(@NotNull @NotNull Consumer<? super T> action)
      If there is no error and the value is present, the action on the value is performed. In any case the initial class is returned.
      Parameters:
      action - action on value, executed if there are no errors
      Returns:
      original Hope instance, with value/error

    • onSuccess

      @NotNull @NotNull Glitch onSuccess(@NotNull @NotNull Consumer<? super T> action)
      Set the action on success

      In the event of an error, the action is not performed.

      Parameters:
      action - action to be taken if successful
      Returns:
      Glitch to set the action on failure
      See Also:
      • Glitch.onFailure(Consumer)
